meta_description: The Mark Twain House is the 25-room Victorian home where legendary author Samuel Clemens (Mark Twain), lived with his family from 1874 to 1891 and wrote his greatest works, including The Adventures of Tom Sawyer and Adventures of Huckleberry Finn.Mark Twain House
hours_text:
## Hours & Admission

**Due to the limited capacity on tours, we recommend that you purchase tickets in advance, as tours sell out days ahead of time. If you choose to show up without purchasing tickets in advance we may not be able to accommodate you and your group.**

[Visit Us](/admission/ "/admission/")

collections_text:
# A House with a Heart and Soul

[Book Your Tour](https://marktwainhouse.org/admission "https://marktwainhouse.org/admission")

## Public Opening at 11:30 a.m.

### Delayed Opening - January 17, 2026

## February 12, 2026, 7:00PM-8:00PM (In Person)

### GODWIN with Joseph O’Neill

[Learn More & Register Here](https://marktwainhouse.org/event/godwin-with-joseph-oneill-in-person/ "https://marktwainhouse.org/event/godwin-with-joseph-oneill-in-person/")

## January 28, 7:00PM-8:00PM (In-Person)

### THE WILDERNESS with Angela Flournoy

[Learn More & Register Here](https://marktwainhouse.org/event/the-wilderness-with-angela-flournoy-in-person/ "https://marktwainhouse.org/event/the-wilderness-with-angela-flournoy-in-person/")

## Friday January 30 at 6 PM and Saturday January 31 at 1 PM

### Say It With Flowers: A Valentine Craft Workshop

**In this workshop, you’ll learn about the Victorian language of flowers and then use it to craft three paper Valentines that send exactly the message you want–platonic, familial, or romantic!**

[Learn More & Register Here](https://marktwainhouse.org/event/say-it-with-flowers-a-valentine-craft-workshop/2026-01-30/ "https://marktwainhouse.org/event/say-it-with-flowers-a-valentine-craft-workshop/2026-01-30/")

## Open Now

### HOLDING SPACE

[Learn More Here](https://marktwainhouse.org/exhibitions/temporary-exhibits/ "https://marktwainhouse.org/exhibitions/temporary-exhibits/")
